articles.description: Kabul orders its army to honour the two-day ceasefire, warning it will respond if Pakistan violates the agreement.

articles.title: Ardian Raises Record $20 Billion for Europe Infrastructure Bets
articles.description: Investment firm Ardian has raised $20 billion for its flagship infrastructure platform, which is set to invest predominantly in Europe, demonstrating the depth of investor appetite for the region.

articles.description: The US president says the move is "a big stop", but there has been no confirmation so far from Delhi.

articles.title: Ariarne Titmus, Olympic gold medallist, retires from swimming
articles.description: Titmus, famous for beating US swim star Katie Ledecky at the Paris Games, was expected to compete in the 2028 Olympics.

articles.description: Reporters from more than 30 news outlets have vacated the Pentagon, refusing to comply with new reporting restrictions.

articles.title: Forged in fire: The 900°C heat that built Earth’s stable continents
articles.description: New research reveals that Earth’s continents owe their stability to searing heat deep in the planet’s crust. articles.description: It is a common sight you might see around Vancouver’s Chinatown -- graffiti littered or sprayed across the shutters and walls of local businesses.
